Lajitas is situated on FM 170 between the Big Bend National Park and Big Bend Ranch State Park, along the Rio Grande River.
is the closest commercial airport to Lajitas, approximately a 4 hour drive.

is the next closest commercial airport to Lajitas, approximately a 5 hour drive.
You can also reach the area by train from San Antonio and Austin, which have an Amtrak train three times a week to Alpine, about 90 miles from Lajitas.  You can then rent a car there, or get the Lajitas Resort to pick you up for a fee.

There is a large private airport at Lajitas, owned by the Lajitas Resort

with a 7500 ft. (2286 m) runway.  The airport has a landing fee for the aircraft of non-guests.  

Rental cars are available at the Midland and El Paso airports.

junction, then turn right onto FM 170 and continue 14 miles to Lajitas.

From El Paso, approximately 300 miles. Take IH-10 East 118 miles to Van Horn. Take US-90 78 miles through
. Continue to Alpine and turn right onto SH-118 South (Cockrell Street).  Follow SH-118 South 80 miles to the
junction, then turn right onto FM 170 and continue 14 miles to Lajitas.

Lajitas was likely best known for its mayor, Clay Henry III, who happened to be a beer-drinking goat. Alas, beer drinking goats have short life spans, so his mayoral stable gates have closed for good.

value: content=25,000-acre resort between Big Bend National Park and Big Bend State Park with a 103-room resort, public golf club, and real estate division.
